Diagram 1, Slide show

Our human network communicates twenty-four hours a day, seven days a week.

We are constantly working, collaborating, learning, and playing over the network.

We rely on our networks to be available when we need them, no matter what day or hour.

It is critical that network connectivity and services be restored quickly in the event of a failure.

In this chapter, you will learn how to troubleshoot network failures and how to recognize and correct the causes of common network problems.
After completion of this chapter, you should be able to:
Describe the troubleshooting process.
Describe the utilities used to verify TCP/IP connectivity.
Identify and describe common hardware and connection issues in wired and wireless networks.
Use the troubleshooting process to document problems and interact with a help desk.
